featured.text: Early this past summer the three whales were pronounced fit enough to be returned to the Atlantic Ocean.
Over the past century, hard hats have advanced considerably, evolving from canvas and leather to aluminum, fiberglass, and, eventually, to thermoplastic.
The students lost an average of 2.34 kilograms during the past two months, and the student who lost the most, the nine-year-old Howard Chang, shed more than six kilograms.
In her novels, Morrison brings in different elements of the African American past, their struggles, problems and cultural memory.

other.text: During this period, many people travel back to their hometowns and spend time with loved ones, both past and present.
But few people know that in the past, control of Zanzibar meant access to unimaginable wealth.
In the past, flashing red lights and even lion faces have been unsuccessfully trialed in an attempt to keep deer off the tracks.
They resist foreign influence because they were enslaved in the past.
In the past, the signatures of athletes and VIPs __________.
The ideas about family have changed _____ in the past twenty years.
In the past, there wasn’t much conflict __33__ dolphins and fishermen, because the numbers of tuna in the ocean were enormous.

definition.en_def: The time or events that have already happened.
definition.example: She often reminisces about her past adventures.
